Dispute_Type: Civil dispute over intellectual property rights
Legal_Issue: Whether Euro Excellence is liable for damages and profits due to copyright infringement of Kraft Canada's artistic works on chocolate bar wrappers
Procedural_Stage: Final determination after remand and motions regarding new evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Kraft proposed 10-25% of gross sales as profit/damages; Court found this reasonable despite lack of precise evidence from Euro Excellence
Decision_Outcome: Euro Excellence must pay $300,000 in damages plus interest and one set of costs
Burden_of_Proof: On Kraft Canada to prove infringement and claim damages
Credibility_Factor: Court accepted Kraft’s proposed range due to lack of cost evidence from Euro Excellence
Legal_Rule: Under Section 35(1) of the Copyright Act, infringer is liable for damages and profits
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard applied to damages assessment
Procedural_Issue: Motions regarding admissibility of new evidence during redetermination
Grounds_for_Claim: Unauthorized sale of products with copyrighted wrappers
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Damages upheld based on agreed range and analysis
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Remand allowed for proper redetermination of damages
Key_Evidence_Considered: Gross sales of $2.8 million, proposed percentage of profits, absence of cost data from defendant
Applicant_Challenge: Kraft Canada sought damages and disgorgement of profits
Defendant_Response: Did not provide evidence of costs or profits
Evidence_Type: Financial records, expert opinion on valuation, legal argument
Remedy_Requested: Damages and share of infringer's profits
Outcome: $300,000 awarded in damages plus interest and costs
Remedy_Sought: Compensatory damages and disgorgement of profits
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial determination after trial and appeal
Authority: Federal Court of Appeal, Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Allegation of unauthorized distribution of copyrighted packaging
Applicable_Process: Litigation through trial, appeal, and remand
Outcome_of_Review: Affirmed liability and supported damage award
Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction under Canadian copyright law
